column1: Revenue  Act.  In  terms  of  section  147  of  the  Inland  Revenue  Act,  a  “financial
“financial  institution”  means  any  person  or  body  of  persons,  corporate  or
unincorporated,  whose  business  or  part  of  whose  business  consists  in  the
acceptance of money by way of deposit, or loan in the form of debenture or
bond or in any other form, and the payment of interest thereon, whether
such acceptance is on its own behalf or on behalf of any other person”.
